channel.title: 2 commands i need/ help 317 server

item.title: 2 commands i need/ help 317 server
item.dc:creator: @divinityms divinityms
item.description:
@divinityms wrote:

If that doesen’t work for you, then you could try my ::yell command.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { String rank = ""; String Message = playerCommand.substring(4).toLowerCase(); if (c.playerRights >= 0) { rank = "[Player]["+ c.playerName +"]:"; if (c.playerRights >= 1) { rank = "@blu@[Mod]@bla@["+ c.playerName +"]:"; } if (c.playerRights >= 2) { rank = "@yel@[Admin]@bla@["+ c.playerName +"]:"; } if (c.playerRights >= 3) { rank = "@red@[Owner]@bla@["+ c.playerName +"] : "; } if (c.playerRights >= 4) { rank = "[Player]["+ c.playerName +"]:"; } if (c.memberStatus >= 1) { rank = "@gre@[Donator]@bla@["+ c.playerName +"]:"; } if (c.memberStatus >= 2) { rank = "@mag@[Super Donator]@bla@["+ c.playerName +"]:"; } for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; c2.sendMessage(rank+Message); } } }
If you want to change the colors, all you do is change the @???@ outside every tag.
Example: “@blu@[Mod]@bla@[”+ c.playerName +"]:";

That would give you a blue [MOD] and a black [Playername]:

Read full topic

item.title: 2 commands i need/ help 317 server
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

See if this works: [code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“yell”)) {
for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];

						if (c.isDonator == 1 && (c.playerRights < 1 || c.playerRights > 3)){
							c2.sendMessage("<shad=6081134>[Donator]</col><img=0>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": "
											+ Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");
						}else if (c.playerRights == 1){
							c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Mod]</col><img=1>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": "
											+ Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");
						}else if (c.playerRights == 2){
							c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Admin]</col><img=2>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": "
											+ Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");
						}else if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("ecstasy")){
							c2.sendMessage("<shad=15695415>[Developer]</col><img=2>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": "
											+ Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");
						}else if (c.playerRights == 3){
							c2.sendMessage("<shad=255>[Owner]</col><img=2>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": "
											+ Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");
						}else if (c.playerRights == 0 && c.isDonator == 0) {
							c.sendMessage("<shad=6081134><img=0>You must be a Donator to use yell!<img=0></col>");
								
						}
					}
				}
			}
    
    
}[/code]

item.description:
@jwags wrote:

i got my yell command to work

[code] if(command.startsWith(“yell”)) {

                           String

Title = "[Player] ";
if

(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("YOUR-NAME

")) Title = "[Owner] ";
if (playerRights == 3)

Title = "[Co-Owner] ";
if (playerRights == 2)

Title = "[Admin] ";
if (playerRights == 1)

Title = "[Moderator] ";
yell(Title + playerName

  • ": " + command.substring(5));
    }[/code]

how can i color code the names
co-owner-brown
owner-orange
admin-purple
mod-red
reg - yellow?

and other one is i dont have a ::commands code, we have to give out the commands by hand, any1 know how to make a list of them? and post that on, thanks
